      • isIndexed

        boolean isIndexed()
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the model has indexed vertex data.
        Returns:
        true if the model has indexed vertex data, false otherwise.

        void getTextureCoordinate​(int texCoordNum,
                          int i,
                          PointD uv)
        Returns the texture coordinate attribute data for the specified vertex.
        Parameters:
        i - The vertex number
        uv - Returns the vertex texture coordinate. The u component is returned via uv.x and the v component is returned via uv.y

      • getIndexType

        java.lang.Class<?> getIndexType()
        Returns the index type. Must be one of:
        • Short.TYPE
        • Integer.TYPE
        • null
        Returns:
        The index type, or null if the model is not indexed.

      • getIndex

        int getIndex​(int i)
        Returns the specified index element.
        Parameters:
        i - The index offset
        Returns:
        The specified index element.

      • getIndices

        java.nio.Buffer getIndices()
        Returns a Buffer containing the index data. The first element of the indices is expected to start at the base pointer of the buffer, ignoring position, plus the index offset. All components per vertex for the attribute data are expected to be packed contiguously.

        The returned Buffer MUST:

        • Be direct
        • Be in native order
        • Not be a slice OR be a slice created from a Buffer whose position was 0
        Returns:

      • getIndexOffset

        int getIndexOffset()
        Returns the offset, in bytes, from the first byte of the Buffer returned by getIndices() of the first index element.
        Returns:

      • getVertices

        java.nio.Buffer getVertices​(int attr)
        Returns a Buffer containing the specified vertex data. The first byte of the data of the specified vertex attribute is expected to start at the base pointer of the buffer, ignoring position, plus the vertex offset for the attribute type. All components per vertex for the attribute data are expected to be packed contiguously; attribute data for consecutive components will be separated by the respective stride bytes as defined by the VertexDataLayout.

        The returned Buffer MUST:

        • Be direct
        • Be in native order
        • Not be a slice OR be a slice created from a Buffer whose position was 0
        Parameters:
        attr - The attribute type. Must be only one of
        • VERTEX_ATTR_COLOR
        • VERTEX_ATTR_NORMAL
        • VERTEX_ATTR_POSITION
        • VERTEX_ATTR_TEXCOORD_0
        Returns:
        The Buffer that contains the specified vertex attribute.
